Class WriteErrorRate

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.apps.physics.spintronics.WriteErrorRate
public class WriteErrorRate extends Object
Write Error Rate (WER) Monte Carlo simulation for spintronic memory devices.

Calculates the probability of write failures in MRAM, SOT-MRAM, and STT-MRAM devices using statistical physics and stochastic simulations.

Error Sources

  • Thermal fluctuations (Néel-Brown model)
  • Current pulse variations
  • Device-to-device variability
  • Read disturb
  • Retention failures

Key Metrics

$$ WER = \exp\left(-\frac{E_b}{k_B T}\right) \cdot f(I, t_p) $$ where $E_b$ is the energy barrier and $f(I, t_p)$ captures write dynamics.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Constructor Details

    • WriteErrorRate

      public WriteErrorRate(Real thermalStability, Real criticalCurrent, Real temperature, Real deviceVariability)
      Creates a WER Monte Carlo simulator.
      Parameters:
      thermalStability - Δ = Eb/kT (dimensionless, typically 40-80)
      criticalCurrent - Critical switching current (A)
      temperature - Operating temperature (K)
      deviceVariability - Device parameter variability (σ/μ)

  • Method Details

    • calculateSTTWriteErrorRate

      public Real calculateSTTWriteErrorRate(Real writeCurrent, Real pulseDuration, int numTrials)
      Calculates WER for STT-MRAM write operation. Uses Sun model for switching probability.
      Parameters:
      writeCurrent - Applied write current (A)
      pulseDuration - Pulse duration (s)
      numTrials - Number of Monte Carlo trials
      Returns:
      Write error rate (probability)

    • calculateSOTWriteErrorRate

      public Real calculateSOTWriteErrorRate(Real chargeCurrent, Real pulseDuration, Real externalField, int numTrials)
      Calculates WER for SOT-MRAM write operation. Includes field-free switching via exchange bias.
      Parameters:
      chargeCurrent - In-plane charge current (A)
      pulseDuration - Pulse duration (s)
      externalField - External z-field for deterministic switching (T)
      numTrials - Number of Monte Carlo trials
      Returns:
      Write error rate

    • calculateRetentionError

      public Real calculateRetentionError(Real retentionTime, int numTrials)
      Calculates retention error rate. Probability of spontaneous switching during idle time.
      Parameters:
      retentionTime - Required retention time (s)
      numTrials - Monte Carlo trials
      Returns:
      Retention error probability

    • calculateReadDisturb

      public Real calculateReadDisturb(Real readCurrent, Real readDuration, int numTrials)
      Calculates read disturb probability. Lower current but longer duration may cause partial switching.
      Parameters:
      readCurrent - Read current (A)
      readDuration - Read pulse duration (s)
      numTrials - Monte Carlo trials
      Returns:
      Read disturb probability

    • sweepWER

      public double[][] sweepWER(double currentMin, double currentMax, int currentSteps, double pulseMin, double pulseMax, int pulseSteps, int trialsPerPoint)
      Runs a comprehensive WER sweep over current and pulse width.
      Parameters:
      currentMin - Minimum current (A)
      currentMax - Maximum current (A)
      currentSteps - Number of current steps
      pulseMin - Minimum pulse duration (s)
      pulseMax - Maximum pulse duration (s)
      pulseSteps - Number of pulse steps
      trialsPerPoint - Monte Carlo trials per point
      Returns:
      2D array of WER values [current][pulse]

    • findRequiredCurrent

      public Real findRequiredCurrent(Real targetWER, Real pulseDuration, int searchTrials)
      Calculates required write current for target WER at given pulse duration.
      Parameters:
      targetWER - Target write error rate (e.g., 1e-6)
      pulseDuration - Pulse duration (s)
      searchTrials - Trials for each search iteration
      Returns:
      Required write current (A)
